page.title: 03A Farrier not a Blacksmith!
page.content: There has been a farrier in Lighthorne for 355 years; the Cole family has been involved for 75 years. The farriers are very busy but they enjoy their work very much.Their customers come from a 15 mile radius to have their horses shod. The farriers had to gain a special qualification(Royal Society of Shoemaking).The shoes last 6 to 7 weeks and the hardest part of the farriers' work is the making of the shoes.The metal that is used is mild steel.It takes 40 minutes to make a set of horseshoes and 40 minutes to put them on. The equipment used is quite new, but the anvil is 80 to 100 years old(the tools are American).All the tools are useful but we think the anvil is the most useful tool. D.Swindells, W.Heath and J.Rickman.
